title.native: 左 パイロット・フィルム

description:
Stories have been told of a legendary craftsman during the Edo-era, by the name of Jingoro Hidari. Today, sculptures accredited to Jingoro can be found throughout Japan, but his very existence is yet to be confirmed. Having lost his foster parent and right arm to the betrayal of his senior apprentices, Jingoro is on a journey of revenge with a mechanical prosthetic arm and his sidekick, “Sleeping Cat.” People soon came to call him Jingoro “Hidari” because of his ability to artfully use his carpentry tools with only his left arm (“hidari” means “left” in Japanese). Finally, Jingoro faces one of his adversaries “Inumaru” and the curtains rise on a fight to the death.

(Source: Niigata International Animation Film Festival)

Note: Public release on 8th March 2023.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Stop Motion
tags.description: Animation style characterized by physical objects being moved incrementally between frames to create the illusion of movement.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Samurai
tags.description: Prominently features warriors of medieval Japanese nobility bound by a code of honor.

tags.name: Steampunk
tags.description: Prominently features technology and designs inspired by 19th-century industrial steam-powered machinery.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

node.description:
[Profile (Whatever)](https://whatever.co/en/team/masa/) | [Website](http://masakawa.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/masakawa) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/masakawa)

Masa is the Chief Creative Officer of Whatever. He has worked as a creative director at 180 Amsterdam, BBH New York, Wieden & Kennedy New York, and other global creative agencies. He founded PARTY in 2011, and after serving as the head of its New York and Taipei studios, founded Whatever in 2018. In 2023, he has also inaugurated as CCO of Open Medical Lab, Inc., He has worked on a wide range of projects, including brand campaigns, TV program development, and music video direction. He has earned more than 100 awards around the world, including Cannes Lions, and has been chosen as one of the Creativity magazine’s “Creative 50,” Fast Company’s “100 most creative people in business,” and AERA magazine’s “100 people breaking out of Japan.”

Born in Tokyo.

After graduating from Sociology Department at Toyo University, Noriko entered TYO Productions Inc. She became a producer in 1995, and created over 100 TV commercials for companies including Coca-Cola (Japan) Company and McDonald.

She has produced TV spots and projects since the birth of the NHK-BS character “Domo” in 1998.

Currently, she has been playing a key role in a wide range of activities, and produced new characters such as “Komaneko” and “PLUG”, advertisements, and picture books.

[Profile (Whatever)](https://whatever.co/team/sachie/)

Sachie is a multi-faced producer with agency and production company experience. After graduating from film school, she pursued a career at the esteemed Tokyo-based film production company TAIYO KIKAKU in 2005, where she produced a wide range of international and award-winning TV commercials, music vides, short films and events. Prior to joining Whatever, Sachie moved to New York in 2015 to work with Party New York on projects surrounding film, interactive installations, events, online content, and innovative products.
(Source: Whatever)

Through his involvement in large-scale video productions, such as Expos, he came to realize that "With video, what is important is creating an experience, and not being confined to a rectangular frame". After experiencing the aurora spreading across the entire sky in 1999, he began working on planetarium dome video, and in 2005 he produced the world's first 360-degree spherical image at Expo 2005 in Aichi.
He continues to produce works that appeal to the viewer's sensibilities, such as interactive images and handmade stop-motion animation works.

Through his involvement in large-scale video productions, such as Expos, he came to realize that "With video, what is important is creating an experience, and not being confined to a rectangular frame". After experiencing the aurora spreading across the entire sky in 1999, he began working on planetarium dome video, and in 2005 he produced the world's first 360-degree spherical image at Expo 2005 in Aichi.
He continues to produce works that appeal to the viewer's sensibilities, such as interactive images and handmade stop-motion animation works.

Born in Tokyo.

After graduating from Sociology Department at Toyo University, Noriko entered TYO Productions Inc. She became a producer in 1995, and created over 100 TV commercials for companies including Coca-Cola (Japan) Company and McDonald.

She has produced TV spots and projects since the birth of the NHK-BS character “Domo” in 1998.

Currently, she has been playing a key role in a wide range of activities, and produced new characters such as “Komaneko” and “PLUG”, advertisements, and picture books.

[Profile (Whatever)](https://whatever.co/team/rika/)

Born and raised in Saitama, Rika Ono started her career in foodservice but later switched industries to work for the creative studio, where she managed the company accounts, general affairs and the PrivacyMark System. She helped to launch a magazine and contributed to the publication as an editor and writer. Rika is experienced in creating web content and also frequently hosts lectures, talk sessions, and workshops. She joined dot by dot inc. in 2017 and Whatever in 2019, where she currently manages the everyday business and public relations of the company.

(Source: Whatever)

[Profile (Whatever)](https://whatever.co/team/yusuke/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/fuyong) | [facebook](https://www.facebook.com/yusuke.tominaga.73)

Yusuke Tominaga is the CEO and co-founder of Whatever. His career in the creative industry began when he helped establish AID-DCC in 2000 while still a student at Ritsumeikan University. He founded dot by dot inc. in 2014 and Whatever in 2019, the latter being a joint venture with the creative agency PARTY New York, where he served as Executive Producer from 2018. In Aug 2019, joint-invested with Tohokushinsha Film Corporation and established WTFC, Inc., inaugurated as CSO.
Having earned accolades from Cannes Lions, The Webbys, Japan Media Arts Festival and more, Yusuke’s experience in creative production spans across advertising, experiential marketing, music videos, fashion, and TV.
Outside Whatever, Yusuke is a shareholder and executive partner of the tech director collective—BASSDRUM. He actively invests in startup products such as COTODAMA’s Lyric Speaker and Yummy Sake—a free service that employs AI as a tool to profile the ideal Japanese rice wine for each user at blind tasting sessions. He also operates a co-working space “Wherever” for creative companies in Tokyo to fulfill his goal of building professional network with creatives around the world.

(Source: Whatever)

[Profile (Whatever)](https://whatever.co/team/seki/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/seki_kenichi) | [facebook](https://www.facebook.com/seki.kenichi)

After working for several ad agencies, he joined a creative agency “AID-DCC.” Later, he co-founded Whatever (and its predecessor “dot by dot”) .
As a producer, he took part in many highly challenging projects that venture into uncharted territory, including content experiences, software, and service/product development.
(Source: Whatever)

Graduated from Tama Art University, Faculty of Art and Design, Department of Design, ImD Course in 2017. Worked at Puzzle Inc. until 2020. Joined dwarf in the same year as a freelance staff member and joined the company in 2021. Likes games and Halloween.
(Source: dwarf)

[Profile (Whatever)](https://whatever.co/team/chieko/)

Chieko’s early childhood years at an international school sparked her interest in bringing people together across borders and making the world a better place. Prior to joining Whatever in 2021 as an associate producer, she worked as a freelance project manager for various multinational media companies, and was also part of the global non-profit organization AIESEC, feeding her passion for positive social impact and all things creative. 
While she is convinced that she herself is all blues and no rhythm, she loves Prince, James Brown and Aretha Franklin.
(Source: Whatever)

Graduated from London College of Printing and joined TYO Productions Inc in 2004. Mother of two children.
Worked on character development and promotion design for Paramount Home Entertainment and WOWOW, produced ‘Komaneko Exhibition’, museum workshop for ‘Alphapets’ and is currently in charge of PR and creative control for Domo and Komaneko.
Other works include graphics and website for NHK’s The Great East Japan Earthquake’s support project ‘Hana wa Saku’, animation part of ‘Dokonoko’ app, and produced short animation & TV CM for Nintendo 3DS ‘Poochy & Yoshi's Woolly World’.
(Source: dwarf)

[Profile (Whatever)](https://whatever.co/team/sachie/)

Sachie is a multi-faced producer with agency and production company experience. After graduating from film school, she pursued a career at the esteemed Tokyo-based film production company TAIYO KIKAKU in 2005, where she produced a wide range of international and award-winning TV commercials, music vides, short films and events. Prior to joining Whatever, Sachie moved to New York in 2015 to work with Party New York on projects surrounding film, interactive installations, events, online content, and innovative products.
(Source: Whatever)

Graduated from Tokyo University of Foreign Studies with a degree in Czech and worked for a web production company before joining dwarf as a production assistant in July 2017.
After working as a production assistant on Rilakkuma to Kaoru-san, the Nippon TV drama Survival Wedding and the NHK Domo-kun 20th Anniversary Campaign Song music video, she is currently working as an associate producer/publicist.
(Source: dwarf)
